newsitem.title: USA: Sheridan Healthcare sees higher qtly EPS.
newsitem.headline: Sheridan Healthcare sees higher qtly EPS.

text.p: Sheridan Healthcare said Thursday that it expects to earn 18 cents a share after-tax in the quarter ended June 30. That compares to earnings of 15 cents a share for the same quarter last year.

Sheridan said in a statement that income tax expense was reduced by a loss carryforward from the prior year for both the second quarter of 1997 and the second quarter of 1996. Without the loss carryforwards, expected earnings per share would be 15 cents for the just ended second quarter.
